name: Α / Ω v1.1
description:
It's been a while since I last played a Chaos Theory deck, but with Alpha and Omega, the little Wünderkind might actually be the best Identity for this kind of deck.

When you have both A & Ω, no server can be secure with less than 3 pieces of ICE. If they do have 3 or more, though, there is no way to pass.

So I thought of a few solutions to the problem: 1 - Parasites and/or Kraken to simply trash them; 2 - Crypsis, expensive and time consuming, but reliable; 3 - Escher, to rearrange them.

The deck mainly focuses on the first, therefore you have plenty of Anarch cards to help out, and 2 copies of Kraken to help reduce the total levels of ICE on a server.

Since A & Ω are quite expensive to use, there's Magnum Opus to help out with the economy. Memory should not be an issue, thanks to the extra MU by the Wünderkind, and Grimoire will help as well with a couple extra MUs. Parasites should, after all, be installed only when you need them during a run, and "sleep" on a Personal Workshop until then.

name: ニセー
description:
Here I am publishing a rough draft for identity that isn't even realeased yet. -_-

Ever since I have seen the psi cards, I was really excited about them and determined to make a deck with all the Mushin-no-shins, Toshiyuki Sakais and Plan Bs to mess with foe's mind.

Eventually I went down a different path. Path to create as many "scoring windows" as needed. RSVP, Ash and psi cards are primary tool to do that. There is also Snoop and Swordsman to evaluate and cut down the runner's possibilities. Another option is classic Jinteki by more elaborate means such as Bullfrog>Inazuma>Komaina>Shock! Hokusai or EMP.

Obviously, this deck is yet to get more refined and the post itself is rather a forum for those who are as enthusiastic about this new mechanic as I am.

name: Fast Jinteki 1.0
description:
My build of a fast Jinteki deck based on the spoiled cards from Honor&Profit.

It features mostly cheap ETR ice, as the plane is to score quickly 4 points, even if this means conceding agenda points to the runner (losing a Medical Breaktrough is actually useful).

When at match point a Mushin No Shin combined with Plan B or Project Junebug can win the game if run, or be a token reserve for the final Trick of Light otherwise.

name: The Notoriety of Kate
description: Winner of Checkmate Store Championship 2014. Use Doppelgänger to score the last points with Notoriety.

name: LLDS processor V. HJ.1.0
description: My build of the Team covenant LLDS processor build found here. http://teamcovenant.com/saetzero/2014/02/10/the-llds-processor-deck-skeleton/ Untested but I'm dying to play it. :)

name: The Institute
description:
A take on the new ID, Tennin Institute. I think it works in two ways: play it like NEXT Design, with plenty of good ETR or scary ICE; or you can play it like classic Jinteki remotes and trap centrals -- ice up a little, put Shocks in Archives, score a House of Knives and start shooting them up.

This deck is a take on the first type of play I mentioned. This doesn't play tricks much and aims to score a Nisei or a House of Knives first, so it can ward off incoming attacks.

Flatline with Inazuma -> Komainu + House of Knives proc + Neurals.

name: Fast Ad & Big ice
description:
Fun deck with big ice for free and Fast ad for easy scoring.

Luck on Accelerated Beta Test can often be the victory.

name: Mission Possible
description:
Use your resource economy (i.e. Kati and Liberated Account) to fuel Blackguard.

Hack often and hack early; misdirect credits to R&D or Archives by FAO, or your innate expose / Infiltration with Blackguard out. Use Sneakdoor if they've made HQ a problem. Keyhole up against Jinteki shenanigans and for faster access.

Sustain with Kati, Yog, Sucker tokens, Crypsis and your other programs. Levy for later recursion.

name: Dew Refinery
description:
Lots of remotes, lots of Sundew. GRNDL Refinery is maybe my new favorite card in this deck. Throw it behind Chimera and advance it twice (they will come for it). Encryption makes it hard to trash and RP identity makes it even harder to justify. Rich horizontal Jinteki! Can't wait for Diversified Portfolio to come out.

Play naked braintrusts in remotes and watch them squirm whenever you use Shipments to install three new remotes with one click. Bad runners will never run your remotes (just install your agendas naked for extended stays), good runners will make calculated remote runs (make them pay to trash and protect Sundew and GRNDL with Chimera.

Very similar to Db0's Untrashable (a beauty of a deck), but this is actually built from my old RP deck that used Encryption + Shipment to shell game the runner. Sundew, GRNDL Refinery and Jackson didn't exist back then...so the deck struggled mightily. This one, however, is formidable.

Weakness = Atman...but nobody has ever put one out against me at strength 2. That would slay me I think.

I like 49-card corp in case of long, drag-out matches. This one is currently at 48.

name: Gabe ABR
description: Recreated Always Be Running with Gabe. You might like knight here, if you're okay with falling back on shit breakers from criminal. Just stick in 3 knight and readjust. Basically make a successful run 1 time per turn, more if possible, and get rewarded big.

name: Gabe ABR - Knights
description: Same as the other build, only with Knights. Still running the decent breaker suite as a fall back, putting heavy use to those special orders.

name: Retrashable mk 0.1 post-TC
description:
Definitely inspired by db0's untrashable, own personal take.

Will relook to see if it is better served with full complement of Snares and Shocks, and if that means Celebrity Gift comes back in.

name: Andromeda - Smooth Criminal - v2.0
description: second attempt with Andromeda. dropped events, added resources and changed breaker configuration. -1 corroder, crypsis, garrote. +3 faerie -1 pro contacts. +1 kati +2 crash space +3 compromised employees -1 account siphon -2 FAO -3 hostage +2 quality time

name: Always Advance v0.1
description: Defend your central servers, then start creating remotes and always advance when possible. Lure the runner to traps or just score agendas. Still need some work

name: Next Level 4.0
description: Includes lots of cheap ice to support NEXT Design and Accelerated Beta Test. Click intensive economy with Efficiency Committee, Gila, & Melange.

name: Mac & Cheese 4.0
description: Kate is travelling light with her portable rig of recurring tricks.

name: Gabriel Caballero Santiago "I'm on a horse"
Remote Frustration
description:
Reworked the deck. db0's Untrashable really fits the archetype well and it's hard to find excuses to deviate away from an already solid formula.

Updates and Comparisons to Untrashable:

I still don't like Snare! It just feels way too random to feel effective and is completely countered by Keyhole. I started playing this deck precisely to get away from the random luck and bluffing.

The single Ronin might seem contradictory to my previous statement. I like how this feels like a trap, but it actually goes somewhere. It forces the runner to act and is buffed by encryption protocols. If they let it go you can fire it off for a cool 3 net damage, which is more cost efficient net damage than say a neural EMP.

I like the Himitsus for early blockage, either on remotes or centrals until I can find that good piece of taxing ice.

Since a lot of the ice doesn't actually have ETR, Sensei works to patch up a lot of those leaks. I've dropped a Tsurugi (and remaining two will probably also go when Pup is eventually released).

Potential Changes:

Ash may change back to corporate troubleshooter. Good for sticking certain pieces of ice at crucial moments and also less influence. A single chimera might be all it takes to protect a server.
